derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English galingale, via Old French from Arabic ḵalanjān, perhaps from Chinese gāoliángjiāng, from gāoliáng (the name of a district in Guangdong Province, China) + jiāng 'ginger'

means.word_mean: 1. southeastern Asian perennial with aromatic roots
2. European sedge having rough-edged leaves and spikelets of reddish flowers and aromatic roots
